sub_topic: Finding the vertex cover of a graph.
message_1:
Consider a graph with vertices {A, B, C, D, E} and edges (A,B), (B,C), (B,D), and (C,E). 

What is the minimum size vertex cover of this graph?
message_2:
A vertex cover is a set of vertices such that each edge in the graph is incident to at least one vertex in the set. The minimum size vertex cover is the smallest possible set of vertices that covers all edges.

In this graph, we can choose vertices B and C as our vertex cover. This covers all the edges:

- (A,B) is covered by B
- (B,C) is covered by B and C
- (B,D) is covered by B
- (C,E) is covered by C

No smaller vertex cover exists, so the minimum size vertex cover of this graph has a size of 2, with vertices {B, C}.
